item.title: Executing "lsmem" may cause a kernel panic in is_mem_section_removable() or hang the system
item.description: Applies To Linux lsmem utility Intel Optane Persistent Memory Issue When executing the ’lsmem’ utility with persistent memory installed, Debian based systems, such as Ubuntu, may hang with no error reported and require a power-cycle to recover. Fedora, CentOS, and RHEL, for example, may crash and produce an error similar to the following: // Fedora Non-Debug Kernel: $ lsmem Killed // Fedora Debug Kernel: # lsmem Segmentation fault When the kernel panics, dmesg will report errors similar to the following examples:
